channel.title: Full Screen
channel.description: Hi is there any way to get this game to run in full screen

item.title: Full Screen
item.dc:creator: Teq
item.description:
I have another issue, the game works fine when i put “-safe” in launch options, it loads it in a window. Now as soon as i try to run it fullscreen, my screen turns black with two lines flashing on the left side (i hear the intro music and the buttons click when i move the mouse). Not even ctrl + alt + del or anything works and i have to restart my computer in order to get it working again.

Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Full Screen
item.dc:creator: Vigo_Doria
item.description:
Yeah !

It is worked ! The real trick is, after you changed it to 16 : 9 you have to change the resolution too while in the same menu, in my case it was 1366 X 768 !

Now i can enjoy this super game in its “full” glory !

Thank you all !

item.title: Full Screen
item.dc:creator: mlambrechts
item.description:
Vigo Doria:

This is my first source game, so i don’t know if others would work well.

The 16:9 aspect ratio likely would do the trick, i tried it earlier, but whenever i change it, the video option shows it accepted it, but when i go into the main menu, and back to the video option, it shows that it is still on 4 : 3 !? Looks like it is not want to accept it.

But i still have hope, i know someone will come here and will tell me the golden hint ^,^

Hi, I had the same problem.
The -fullscreen option will not work, since the game is already launched in full screen, but the borders are cut of.
So you have to go at the video menu of the game. There you will discover (as I did) that it is very stuborn in not accepting your settings. The only thing you can do is toggle the video resolution untill you can set the game into 16:9. It’s obviously a bug, but it worked on my laptop after some minutes trying and trying again…
